thread.title: Is this a new Adele song?
thread.title_full: Is this a new Adele song? - CNN.com

author: Lisa Respers France
title: Is this a new Adele song?
text:
Story highlights A commercial aired on British TV that sounded like Adele singing Her new album is reportedly due out this year (CNN) Fans hungry for new Adele music may have just gotten a nibble.
A teaser promo aired this weekend on British TV during a broadcast of "The X Factor" that sounded like Adele singing the lyrics "Hello, it's me / I was wondering if after all these years you'd like to meet / To go over / Everything / They say that time's supposed to heal ya / But I ain't done much healing."
The words appear on the blank screen followed by an ellipsis.
According to Billboard, Adele's "25" album is slated to happen at some point this year. Not much is known about the followup to her smash sophomore 2011 album "21" though reportedly collaborators include Tobias Jesso Jr., producer/DJ Danger Mouse and OneRepublic's Ryan Tedder.
Buzz increased that the clip is a new Adele song after the One Republic Twitter account tweeted her name and a smiley face
Read More Adele :)
— OneRepublic (@OneRepublic) October 18, 2015 Adele has been pretty much off the music scene, despite singing "Skyfall," the theme for the 2012 James Bond of the same name. That same year she gave birth to a son with boyfriend Simon Konecki, and there has been much speculation over whether the two are still together. The Grammy-winning singer is notoriously private and has not confirmed whether she is indeed now single or not.
Suffice it to say fans are excited with the possibility that the return is near.
I bet that dude deliberately broke up with Adele to save the music industry.
— Ronan Farrow (@RonanFarrow) October 18, 2015 The 30 sec music clip that has the industry in a frenzy. Oh boy... @OfficialAdele is back #25 #Adele pic.twitter.com/u3MJPSuYQL
— BBC Newsbeat (@BBCNewsbeat) October 18, 2015 The day Adele's next album comes out, I'm selling all of my earthly possessions, save for my iPod and headphones, and wading into the ocean
— Matt Bellassai (@MattBellassai) October 18, 2015 The whole world when this new Adele single comes out pic.twitter.com/ubOik5aBnK
— Jason Lipshutz (@jasonlipshutz) October 18, 2015
